page.title: 12St Mary's church
page.content: St Mary's church stands on a hill overlooking the village green, and is about 800 years old. It has been a landmark for sailors from Saxon days. A great deal of repair work is needed on the chrch especially the stonework and the heating system Â£500000 is the estimated cost. The Rector is the Reverend James Thompson who lives at the Rectory in Easington. Church services are on Sunday; Holy Communion 8.30 - 3 pm, Parish Communion 9.30 am, Evensong 6 pm. Weekdays; Holy Communion Monday 7pm, Wednesday 9.30 am, Friday 7 pm. Activities in the church hall are the Sunday school, Brownies, Mothers' Union, Guides, Youth Club and bingo.
